```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(lubridate)
```

In February 2022, I began keeping a spreadsheet of every time I set a new personal best in Mario Kart.

```{r}
tt <- read_csv("../_data/time-trials.csv", 
               col_types = cols(total = "c")) %>% 
  filter(date < "2022-03-01") %>% 
  mutate(total = lubridate::ms(total)) 

test <- tt %>% 
  mutate(yr = year(date),
         mth = month(date),
         day = day(date),
         hour = hour(time),
         min = minute(time),
         dt = make_datetime(year = yr, month = mth, day = day, hour = hour, min = min))
```

```{r}
gg <- ggplot(test, aes(x= dt, y=total, color = cup, group = track)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  scale_y_time() +
  labs(x = "",
       y = "",
       color = "Cup") +
  theme_minimal()
```

All PBs

```{r, layout = "l-page", fig.height=6}
ggplotly(gg)
```

## Mushroom Cup

```{r}
mr <- test %>% 
  filter(cup == "Mushroom")
```

```{r}
ggMr <- ggplot(mr, aes(x= dt, y=total, color = track)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  scale_y_time() +
  labs(x = "",
       y = "",
       color = "Track") +
  theme_minimal()

ggplotly(ggMr)
```
